pageContext.claim: “I don't dispute anything. ... So when you look at the overall government, there’s really very little dispute.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump makes the astonishing claim that never disputes reports and findings by his own administration. He has done so on everything from Russia's influence in the 2016 election to climate change to North Korea to the murder of journalist Jamal Khashoggi by the Saudis. Trump suggests it doesn't matter much because the government publishes tons of information that he doesn't dispute. But that's a misleading way of framing the issue; what he does dispute is hugely consequential.
